item.description: ssued By Pittsburgh - PA, US, National Weather Service Affected Area Wetzel County Description ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MONROE... SOUTHEASTERN BELMONT...NORTH CENTRAL WETZEL AND MARSHALL COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 217 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Woodsfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Moundsville, New Martinsville, Woodsfield, Powhatan Point, Glen Dale, Beallsville, Clarington, Jerusalem, Wilson, Cameron, Alledonia, Grove Oak, Proctor, Woodlands, Lynn Camp, Laings, and Grand Vue Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN; MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH

item.title: Two rounds of showers and storms are expected on Wednesday.
item.description: Two rounds of showers and storms are expected on Wednesday. One in the morning hours and then another one later in the day. Our confidence in exact timing of either one is low, but the primary threat will be damaging wind. The second round likely brings the higher severe threat. Most of our area is in a Slight Risk (2/5) for severe weather.
